intro: Loxogramme ensiformis, commonly known as the arrowhead fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, arrow-shaped fronds that are typically 10–30 cm in length. The plant thrives in freshwater environments, such as ponds and streams, and is often found in shaded, moist habitats. Its rhizomes are creeping and produce dense colonies, contributing to its ability to colonize wetlands effectively. The fronds are usually bright green and have a delicate, feathery appearance that enhances its ornamental value in aquatic gardens.
